Posts.Title: Confused -- which is worse ? Goldycat123 Goldycat123

Posts.Content: Goldycat123 wrote: I had a lumpectomy two days ago. The incision is probably 4 inches long and the sentinal lobe incision is about 3 inches. Thy took out a few nodes and took out about the size of an apple from my left breast . It wasn't a huge lump, it was various ducts that contained cancer cells. I'm still Stge 0 dcis I believe unless pathology says there's more going on or spread . Is it normal to feel a buzzing vibrating feeling on the incision ? Dx 6/20/2013, DCIS, 6cm+, Stage 0, Grade 3, 0/2 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Radiation Therapy Breast Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: After my lumpectomy... Goldycat123 juliaanna

Posts.Content: Goldycat123 wrote: Well I'm ER Negative and also PR Negative , and I'm waiting genetic testing results as well as having an MRI tomorrow - so then ill be waiting for those results also - my confusion is : Is it worse if I end up TRIPLE NEGATIVE - with negative on the genetic testing , then have to maybe have Chemo added to my radiation and have my BC harder to fight ? --- OR ---- positive genetic testing. Then they'll suggest I get a double masectimy and maybe ovaries out also ? I don't know what's going to happen and I don't even know how I feel about all these "unknowns"!! :-/ Dx 6/20/2013, DCIS, 6cm+, Stage 0, Grade 3, 0/2 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Radiation Therapy Breast Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Jul 8, 2013 07:19PM Goldycat123 wrote: Hi , actually I didn't have the lumpectomy yet , that's in about two weeks , so I was diagnosed with DCIS, yet I don't know yet if they'll find anything else from the lymph nodes or the MRI . I guess I just have to wait and see how it all pans out don't I ...
Posts.Title: Confused -- which is worse ? Goldycat123 Goldycat123

Posts.Content: Jul 9, 2013 11:36AM Goldycat123 wrote: Well I was diagnosed a couple weeks ago also, and the next steps I had was appointments to meet the surgeon(to have a lumpectomy that's in 2 weeks), had an appointment with the Oncologist , and one with the Radiologist (cuz ill have radiation treatments after the surgery) today I have an MRI . Last week I had genetic testing ( blood test ) . So you'll most likely have similar appointments . So sorry for your news but it sounds very similar to my situation so you're not alone !
Posts.Title: Confused -- which is worse ? Goldycat123 Goldycat123

Posts.Content: Jun 21, 2013 02:02PM Goldycat123 wrote: Well this is all so new to me and its interesting to read all your comments... This coming Tuesday I have my first consultation appt with the Oncologist about radiation treatments. I've been wondering how it will make me feel . I'm thankful to have this website to look at so I don't feel alone in all of this. One good thing for me is so far I don't have to have chemo . Just radiation. And a lumpectomy . So I guess I'm very fortunate . It's still scary though ......
